properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the volume. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the volume. Changing this updates the volume's name.

properties.name: description

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone for the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The image ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: source_vol_id
properties.description: • source_vol_id - (Optional) The volume ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to associate with the volume. Changing this updates the existing volume metadata.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Optional) The type of volume to create. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: region

properties.name: attach_mode
properties.description: • attach_mode - (Optional) Specify whether to attach the volume as Read-Only (ro) or Read-Write (rw). Only values of ro and rw are accepted. If left unspecified, the Block Storage API will apply a default of rw.

properties.name: device
properties.description: • device - (Optional) The device to tell the Block Storage service this volume will be attached as. This is purely for informational purposes. You can specify auto or a device such as /dev/vdc.

properties.name: host_name

properties.name: initiator
properties.description: • initiator - (Optional) The iSCSI initiator string to make the connection.

properties.name: multipath

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Optional) The iSCSI initiator OS type.

properties.name: platform

properties.description: • wwpn - (Optional) An array of wwpn strings. Used for Fibre Channel connections.

properties.name: wwnn
properties.description: • wwnn - (Optional) A wwnn name. Used for Fibre Channel connections.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. Flavors are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new flavor.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the flavor. Changing this creates a new flavor.

properties.name: ram
properties.description: • ram - (Required) The amount of RAM to use, in megabytes. Changing this creates a new flavor.

properties.name: vcpus
properties.description: • vcpus - (Required) The number of virtual CPUs to use. Changing this creates a new flavor.

properties.name: disk
properties.description: • disk - (Required) The amount of disk space in gigabytes to use for the root (/) partition. Changing this creates a new flavor.

properties.name: swap
properties.description: • swap - (Optional) The amount of disk space in megabytes to use. If unspecified, the default is 0. Changing this creates a new flavor.

properties.name: rx_tx_factor
properties.description: • rx_tx_factor - (Optional) RX/TX bandwith factor. The default is 1. Changing this creates a new flavor.

properties.name: is_public
properties.description: • is_public - (Optional) Whether the flavor is public. Changing this creates a new flavor.

properties.name: extra_specs
properties.description: • extra_specs - (Optional) Key/Value pairs of metadata for the flavor.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new flavor access.

properties.name: flavor_id
properties.description: • flavor_id - (Required) The UUID of flavor to use. Changing this creates a new flavor access.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Required) The UUID of tenant which is allowed to use the flavor. Changing this creates a new flavor access.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. A Compute client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with a compute instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

properties.name: pool
properties.description: • pool - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floatingip_associate.

properties.name: floating_ip
properties.description: • floating_ip - (Required) The floating IP to associate.

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Required) The instance to associte the floating IP with.

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - (Optional) The specific IP address to direct traffic to.

properties.name: wait_until_associated
properties.description: • wait_until_associated - (Optional) In cases where the OpenStack environment does not automatically wait until the association has finished, set this option to have Terraform poll the instance until the floating IP has been associated. Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the server instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional; Required if image_name is empty and not booting from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The image ID of the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: image_name
properties.description: • image_name - (Optional; Required if image_id is empty and not booting from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The name of the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: flavor_id
properties.description: • flavor_id - (Optional; Required if flavor_name is empty) The flavor ID of the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

properties.name: flavor_name
properties.description: • flavor_name - (Optional; Required if flavor_id is empty) The name of the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: • security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names or ids to associate with the server. Changing this results in adding/removing security groups from the existing server. Note: When attaching the instance to networks using Ports, place the security groups on the Port and not the instance.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone in which to create the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the instance. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from within the instance. Changing this updates the existing server metadata.

properties.name: config_drive
properties.description: • config_drive - (Optional) Whether to use the config_drive feature to configure the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: admin_pass
properties.description: • admin_pass - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the server. Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.

properties.name: key_pair
properties.description: • key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: block_device
properties.description: • block_device - (Optional) Configuration of block devices. The block_device structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server. You can specify multiple block devices which will create an instance with multiple disks. This configuration is very flexible, so please see the following reference for more information.

properties.name: scheduler_hints
properties.description: • scheduler_hints - (Optional) Provide the Nova scheduler with hints on how the instance should be launched. The available hints are described below.

properties.name: personality
properties.description: • personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure is described below.

properties.name: stop_before_destroy
properties.description: • stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly. If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.

properties.name: force_delete
properties.description: • force_delete - (Optional) Whether to force the OpenStack instance to be forcefully deleted. This is useful for environments that have reclaim / soft deletion enabled.

properties.name: power_state
properties.description: • power_state - (Optional) Provide the VM state. Only 'active' and 'shutoff' are supported values. Note: If the initial power_state is the shutoff the VM will be stopped immediately after build and the provisioners like remote-exec or files are not supported.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the instance. Changing this updates the existing instance tags.

properties.name: vendor_options
properties.description: • vendor_options - (Optional) Map of additional vendor-specific options. Supported options are described below.
The network block supports:

properties.name: uuid
properties.description: • uuid - (Required unless port or name is provided) The network UUID to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required unless uuid or port is provided) The human-readable name of the network. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required unless uuid or name is provided) The port UUID of a network to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: fixed_ip_v4
properties.description: • fixed_ip_v4 - (Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv4 address to be used on this network. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: access_network
properties.description: • access_network - (Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.
The block_device block supports:

properties.name: uuid
properties.description: • uuid - (Required unless source_type is set to "blank" ) The UUID of the image, volume, or snapshot. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: source_type
properties.description: • source_type - (Required) The source type of the device. Must be one of "blank", "image", "volume", or "snapshot". Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: volume_size
properties.description: • volume_size - The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume, source=blank and destination=local, and source=blank and destination=volume. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: boot_index
properties.description: • boot_index - (Optional) The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: destination_type
properties.description: • destination_type - (Optional) The type that gets created. Possible values are "volume" and "local". Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: delete_on_termination
properties.description: • delete_on_termination - (Optional) Delete the volume / block device upon termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: device_type
properties.description: • device_type - (Optional) The low-level device type that will be used. Most common thing is to leave this empty. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: disk_bus
properties.description: • disk_bus - (Optional) The low-level disk bus that will be used. Most common thing is to leave this empty. Changing this creates a new server.
The scheduler_hints block supports:

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Optional) A UUID of a Server Group. The instance will be placed into that group.

properties.name: different_host
properties.description: • different_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be scheduled on a different host than all other instances.

properties.name: same_host
properties.description: • same_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be scheduled on the same host of those specified.

properties.name: query
properties.description:
• query - (Optional) A conditional query that a compute node must pass in order to host an instance. The query must use the JsonFilter syntax which is described here. At this time, only simple queries are supported. Compound queries using and, or, or not are not supported. An example of a simple query is:

    [">=", "$free_ram_mb", "1024"]

properties.name: target_cell
properties.description: • target_cell - (Optional) The name of a cell to host the instance.

properties.name: build_near_host_ip
properties.description: • build_near_host_ip - (Optional) An IP Address in CIDR form. The instance will be placed on a compute node that is in the same subnet.

properties.name: additional_properties
properties.description: • additional_properties - (Optional) Arbitrary key/value pairs of additional properties to pass to the scheduler.
The personality block supports:

properties.name: file
properties.description: • file - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.

properties.name: content
properties.description: • content - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
The vendor_options block supports:

properties.name: ignore_resize_confirmation
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean to control whether to ignore manual confirmation of the instance resizing. This can be helpful to work with some OpenStack clouds which automatically confirm resizing of instances after some timeout.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the interface attachment. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new attachment.

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Required) The ID of the Instance to attach the Port or Network to.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Optional) The ID of the Port to attach to an Instance. NOTE: This option and network_id are mutually exclusive.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Optional) The ID of the Network to attach to an Instance. A port will be created automatically. NOTE: This option and port_id are mutually exclusive.

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - (Optional) An IP address to assosciate with the port. NOTE: This option cannot be used with port_id. You must specifiy a network_id. The IP address must lie in a range on the supplied network.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new keypair.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the keypair. Changing this creates a new keypair.

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: • public_key - (Optional) A pregenerated OpenSSH-formatted public key. Changing this creates a new keypair. If a public key is not specified, then a public/private key pair will be automatically generated. If a pair is created, then destroying this resource means you will lose access to that keypair forever.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. A Compute client is needed to create a security group. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new security group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the security group. Changing this updates the name of an existing security group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description for the security group. Changing this updates the description of an existing security group.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Optional) A rule describing how the security group operates. The rule object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the security group rules. As shown in the example above, multiple rule blocks may be used.
The rule block supports:

properties.name: from_port
properties.description: • from_port - (Required) An integer representing the lower bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: to_port
properties.description: • to_port - (Required) An integer representing the upper bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: ip_protocol
properties.description: • ip_protocol - (Required) The protocol type that will be allowed. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Optional) Required if from_group_id or self is empty. The IP range that will be the source of network traffic to the security group. Use 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IP addresses. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with from_group_id or self.

properties.name: from_group_id
properties.description: • from_group_id - (Optional) Required if cidr or self is empty. The ID of a group from which to forward traffic to the parent group. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or self.

properties.name: self
properties.description: • self - (Optional) Required if cidr and from_group_id is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or from_group_id.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new server group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the server group. Changing this creates a new server group.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Required) The set of policies for the server group. All policies are mutually exclusive. See the Policies section for more information. Changing this creates a new server group.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: policies-1
properties.description: » Policies

properties.name: affinity
properties.description: • affinity - All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on the same compute node.

properties.name: anti-affinity
properties.description: • anti-affinity - All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on different compute nodes.

properties.name: soft-affinity
properties.description: • soft-affinity - All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on the same compute node if possible, but if not possible they still will be scheduled instead of failure. To use this policy your OpenStack environment should support Compute service API 2.15 or above.

properties.name: soft-anti-affinity
properties.description: • soft-anti-affinity - All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on different compute nodes if possible, but if not possible they still will be scheduled instead of failure. To use this policy your OpenStack environment should support Compute service API 2.15 or above.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the volume. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new quotaset.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) ID of the project to manage quotas. Changing this creates a new quotaset.

properties.name: fixed_ips
properties.description: • fixed_ips - (Optional) Quota value for fixed IPs. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: floating_ips
properties.description: • floating_ips - (Optional) Quota value for floating IPs. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: injected_file_content_bytes
properties.description: • injected_file_content_bytes - (Optional) Quota value for content bytes of injected files. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: injected_file_path_bytes
properties.description: • injected_file_path_bytes - (Optional) Quota value for path bytes of injected files. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: injected_files
properties.description: • injected_files - (Optional) Quota value for injected files. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: key_pairs
properties.description: • key_pairs - (Optional) Quota value for key pairs. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: metadata_items
properties.description: • metadata_items - (Optional) Quota value for metadata items. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: ram
properties.description: • ram - (Optional) Quota value for RAM. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: security_group_rules
properties.description: • security_group_rules - (Optional) Quota value for security group rules. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: • security_groups - (Optional) Quota value for security groups. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: cores
properties.description: • cores - (Optional) Quota value for cores. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: instances
properties.description: • instances - (Optional) Quota value for instances. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: server_groups
properties.description: • server_groups - (Optional) Quota value for server groups. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.

properties.name: server_group_members
properties.description: • server_group_members - (Optional) Quota value for server groups members. Changing this updates the existing quotaset.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. A Compute client is needed to create a volume attachment. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new volume attachment.

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Required) The ID of the Instance to attach the Volume to.

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: • volume_id - (Required) The ID of the Volume to attach to an Instance.

properties.name: device
properties.description: • device - (Optional) The device of the volume attachment (ex: /dev/vdc). NOTE: Being able to specify a device is dependent upon the hypervisor in use. There is a chance that the device specified in Terraform will not be the same device the hypervisor chose. If this happens, Terraform will wish to update the device upon subsequent applying which will cause the volume to be detached and reattached indefinitely. Please use with caution.

properties.name: multiattach
properties.description: • multiattach - (Optional) Enable attachment of multiattach-capable volumes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V1 Container Infra client. A Container Infra client is needed to create a cluster. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the cluster. Changing this updates the name of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Optional) The project of the cluster. Required if admin wants to create a cluster in another project. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: • user_id - (Optional) The user of the cluster. Required if admin wants to create a cluster template for another user. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: cluster_template_id
properties.description: • cluster_template_id - (Required) The UUID of the V1 Container Infra cluster template. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: create_timeout
properties.description: • create_timeout - (Optional) The timeout (in minutes) for creating the cluster. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: discovery_url
properties.description: • discovery_url - (Optional) The URL used for cluster node discovery. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: docker_volume_size
properties.description: • docker_volume_size - (Optional) The size (in GB) of the Docker volume. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Optional) The flavor for the nodes of the cluster. Can be set via the OS_MAGNUM_FLAVOR environment variable. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: master_flavor
properties.description: • master_flavor - (Optional) The flavor for the master nodes. Can be set via the OS_MAGNUM_MASTER_FLAVOR environment variable. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: keypair
properties.description: • keypair - (Optional) The name of the Compute service SSH keypair. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) The list of key value pairs representing additional properties of the cluster. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: master_count
properties.description: • master_count - (Optional) The number of master nodes for the cluster. Changing this creates a new cluster.

properties.name: node_count
properties.description: • node_count - (Optional) The number of nodes for the cluster. Changing this creates a new cluster.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V1 Container Infra client. A Container Infra client is needed to create a cluster template. If omitted,the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new cluster template.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the cluster template. Changing this updates the name of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Optional) The project of the cluster template. Required if admin wants to create a cluster template in another project. Changing this creates a new cluster template.

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: • user_id - (Optional) The user of the cluster template. Required if admin wants to create a cluster template for another user. Changing this creates a new cluster template.

properties.name: apiserver_port
properties.description: • apiserver_port - (Optional) The API server port for the Container Orchestration Engine for this cluster template. Changing this updates the API server port of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: coe
properties.description: • coe - (Required) The Container Orchestration Engine for this cluster template. Changing this updates the engine of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: cluster_distro
properties.description: • cluster_distro - (Optional) The distro for the cluster (fedora-atomic, coreos, etc.). Changing this updates the cluster distro of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: dns_nameserver
properties.description: • dns_nameserver - (Optional) Address of the DNS nameserver that is used in nodes of the cluster. Changing this updates the DNS nameserver of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: docker_storage_driver
properties.description: • docker_storage_driver - (Optional) Docker storage driver. Changing this updates the Docker storage driver of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: docker_volume_size
properties.description: • docker_volume_size - (Optional) The size (in GB) of the Docker volume. Changing this updates the Docker volume size of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: external_network_id
properties.description: • external_network_id - (Optional) The ID of the external network that will be used for the cluster. Changing this updates the external network ID of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: fixed_network
properties.description: • fixed_network - (Optional) The fixed network that will be attached to the cluster. Changing this updates the fixed network of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: fixed_subnet
properties.description: • fixed_subnet - (Optional) The fixed subnet that will be attached to the cluster. Changing this updates the fixed subnet of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Optional) The flavor for the nodes of the cluster. Can be set via the OS_MAGNUM_FLAVOR environment variable. Changing this updates the flavor of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: master_flavor
properties.description: • master_flavor - (Optional) The flavor for the master nodes. Can be set via the OS_MAGNUM_MASTER_FLAVOR environment variable. Changing this updates the master flavor of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: floating_ip_enabled
properties.description: • floating_ip_enabled - (Optional) Indicates whether created cluster should create floating IP for every node or not. Changing this updates the floating IP enabled attribute of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: http_proxy
properties.description: • http_proxy - (Optional) The address of a proxy for receiving all HTTP requests and relay them. Changing this updates the HTTP proxy address of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: https_proxy
properties.description: • https_proxy - (Optional) The address of a proxy for receiving all HTTPS requests and relay them. Changing this updates the HTTPS proxy address of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (Required) The reference to an image that is used for nodes of the cluster. Can be set via the OS_MAGNUM_IMAGE environment variable. Changing this updates the image attribute of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: insecure_registry
properties.description: • insecure_registry - (Optional) The insecure registry URL for the cluster template. Changing this updates the insecure registry attribute of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: keypair_id
properties.description: • keypair_id - (Optional) The name of the Compute service SSH keypair. Changing this updates the keypair of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) The list of key value pairs representing additional properties of the cluster template. Changing this updates the labels of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: master_lb_enabled
properties.description: • master_lb_enabled - (Optional) Indicates whether created cluster should has a loadbalancer for master nodes or not. Changing this updates the attribute of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: network_driver
properties.description: • network_driver - (Optional) The name of the driver for the container network. Changing this updates the network driver of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: no_proxy
properties.description: • no_proxy - (Optional) A comma-separated list of IP addresses that shouldn't be used in the cluster. Changing this updates the no proxy list of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: public
properties.description: • public - (Optional) Indicates whether cluster template should be public. Changing this updates the public attribute of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: registry_enabled
properties.description: • registry_enabled - (Optional) Indicates whether Docker registry is enabled in the cluster. Changing this updates the registry enabled attribute of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: server_type
properties.description: • server_type - (Optional) The server type for the cluster template. Changing this updates the server type of the existing cluster template.

properties.name: tls_disabled
properties.description: • tls_disabled - (Optional) Indicates whether the TLS should be disabled in the cluster. Changing this updates the attribute of the existing cluster.

properties.name: volume_driver
properties.description: • volume_driver - (Optional) The name of the driver that is used for the volumes of the cluster nodes. Changing this updates the volume driver of the existing cluster template.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) The region in which to create the db instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.

properties.name: flavor_id
properties.description: • flavor_id - (Required) The flavor ID of the desired flavor for the instance. Changing this creates new instance.

properties.name: configuration_id
properties.description: • configuration_id - (Optional) Configuration ID to be attached to the instance. Database instance will be rebooted when configuration is detached.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Specifies the volume size in GB. Changing this creates new instance.

properties.name: datastore
properties.description: • datastore - (Required) An array of database engine type and version. The datastore object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the instance. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: user
properties.description: • user - (Optional) An array of username, password, host and databases. The user object structure is documented below.

properties.name: database
properties.description: • database - (Optional) An array of database name, charset and collate. The database object structure is documented below.
The datastore block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Database engine type to be used in new instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Required) Version of database engine type to be used in new instance. Changing this creates a new instance.
The network block supports:

properties.name: uuid
properties.description: • uuid - (Required unless port is provided) The network UUID to attach to the instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required unless uuid is provided) The port UUID of a network to attach to the instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: fixed_ip_v4
properties.description: • fixed_ip_v4 - (Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv4 address to be used on this network. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: fixed_ip_v6
properties.description: • fixed_ip_v6 - (Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv6 address to be used on this network. Changing this creates a new instance.
The user block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Username to be created on new instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) User's password. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: host
properties.description: • host - (Optional) An ip address or % sign indicating what ip addresses can connect with this user credentials. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: databases
properties.description: • databases - (Optional) A list of databases that user will have access to. If not specified, user has access to all databases on th einstance. Changing this creates a new instance.
The database block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Database to be created on new instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: collate
properties.description: • collate - (Optional) Database collation. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: charset
properties.description: • charset - (Optional) Database character set. Changing this creates a new instance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Required) The ID for the database instance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The ID for the database instance.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) User's password.

properties.name: databases
properties.description: • databases - (Optional) A list of database user should have access to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) The region in which to create the db instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the resource.

properties.name: datastore
properties.description: • datastore - (Required) An array of database engine type and version. The datastore object structure is documented below. Changing this creates resource.

properties.name: configuration
properties.description: • configuration - (Optional) An array of configuration parameter name and value. Can be specified multiple times. The configuration object structure is documented below.
The datastore block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Database engine type to be used with this configuration. Changing this creates a new resource.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Required) Version of database engine type to be used with this configuration. Changing this creates a new resource.
The configuration block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Configuration parameter name. Changing this creates a new resource.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) Configuration parameter value. Changing this creates a new resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 DNS client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: • zone_id - (Required) The ID of the zone in which to create the record set. Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the record set. Note the . at the end of the name. Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The type of record set. Examples: "A", "MX". Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the record set.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the record set.

properties.name: records
properties.description: • records - (Optional) An array of DNS records. Note: if an IPv6 address contains brackets ([ ]), the brackets will be stripped and the modified address will be recorded in the state.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options. Changing this creates a new record set.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the zone. Note the . at the end of the name. Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

properties.name: email
properties.description: • email - (Optional) The email contact for the zone record.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The type of zone. Can either be PRIMARY or SECONDARY. Changing this creates a new zone.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: • attributes - (Optional) Attributes for the DNS Service scheduler. Changing this creates a new zone.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the zone.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the zone.

properties.name: masters
properties.description: • masters - (Optional) An array of master DNS servers. For when type is SECONDARY.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options. Changing this creates a new zone.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new application credential.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A name of the application credential. Changing this creates a new application credential.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the application credential. Changing this creates a new application credential.

properties.name: unrestricted
properties.description: • unrestricted - (Optional) A flag indicating whether the application credential may be used for creation or destruction of other application credentials or trusts. Changing this creates a new application credential.

properties.name: secret
properties.description: • secret - (Optional) The secret for the application credential. If omitted, it will be generated by the server. Changing this creates a new application credential.

properties.name: roles
properties.description: • roles - (Optional) A collection of one or more role names, which this application credential has to be associated with its project. If omitted, all the current user's roles within the scoped project will be inherited by a new application credential. Changing this creates a new application credential.

properties.name: expires_at
properties.description: • expires_at - (Optional) The expiration time of the application credential in the RFC3339 timestamp format (e.g. 2019-03-09T12:58:49Z). If omitted, an application credential will never expire. Changing this creates a new application credential.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The endpoint name.

properties.name: endpoint_region
properties.description: • endpoint_region - (Required) The endpoint region. The region and endpoint_region can be different.

properties.name: url
properties.description: • url - (Required) The endpoint url.

properties.name: interface
properties.description: • interface - (Optional) The endpoint interface. Valid values are public, internal and admin. Default value is public

properties.name: service_id
properties.description: • service_id - (Required) The endpoint service ID.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the project.

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Optional) The domain this project belongs to.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Whether the project is enabled or disabled. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: is_domain
properties.description: • is_domain - (Optional) Whether this project is a domain. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the project.

properties.name: parent_id
properties.description: • parent_id - (Optional) The parent of this project.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new User.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - The name of the role.

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Optional) The domain the role belongs to.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new Role.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Optional; Required if project_id is empty) The domain to assign the role in.

properties.name: group_id
properties.description: • group_id - (Optional; Required if user_id is empty) The group to assign the role to.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Optional; Required if domain_id is empty) The project to assign the role in.

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: • user_id - (Optional; Required if group_id is empty) The user to assign the role to.

properties.name: role_id
properties.description: • role_id - (Required) The role to assign.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the user.

properties.name: default_project_id
properties.description: • default_project_id - (Optional) The default project this user belongs to.

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Optional) The domain this user belongs to.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Whether the user is enabled or disabled. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: extra
properties.description: • extra - (Optional) Free-form key/value pairs of extra information.

properties.name: ignore_change_password_upon_first_use
properties.description: • ignore_change_password_upon_first_use - (Optional) User will not have to change their password upon first use. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: ignore_password_expiry
properties.description: • ignore_password_expiry - (Optional) User's password will not expire. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: ignore_lockout_failure_attempts
properties.description: • ignore_lockout_failure_attempts - (Optional) User will not have a failure lockout placed on their account. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: multi_factor_auth_enabled
properties.description: • multi_factor_auth_enabled - (Optional) Whether to enable multi-factor authentication. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: multi_factor_auth_rule
properties.description: • multi_factor_auth_rule - (Optional) A multi-factor authentication rule. The structure is documented below. Please see the Ocata release notes for more information on how to use mulit-factor rules.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the user.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The password for the user.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new User.
The multi_factor_auth_rule block supports:

properties.name: rule
properties.description: (Required) A list of authentication plugins that the user must authenticate with.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The service name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The service description.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The service type.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) The service status. Defaults to true.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: container_format
properties.description: • container_format - (Required) The container format. Must be one of "ami", "ari", "aki", "bare", "ovf".

properties.name: disk_format
properties.description: • disk_format - (Required) The disk format. Must be one of "ami", "ari", "aki", "vhd", "vmdk", "raw", "qcow2", "vdi", "iso".

properties.name: local_file_path
properties.description: • local_file_path - (Optional) This is the filepath of the raw image file that will be uploaded to Glance. Conflicts with image_source_url.

properties.name: image_cache_path
properties.description: • image_cache_path - (Optional) This is the directory where the images will be downloaded. Images will be stored with a filename corresponding to the url's md5 hash. Defaults to "$HOME/.terraform/image_cache"

properties.name: image_source_url
properties.description: • image_source_url - (Optional) This is the url of the raw image that will be downloaded in the image_cache_path before being uploaded to Glance. Glance is able to download image from internet but the gophercloud library does not yet provide a way to do so. Conflicts with local_file_path.

properties.name: min_disk_gb
properties.description: • min_disk_gb - (Optional) Amount of disk space (in GB) required to boot image. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: min_ram_mb
properties.description: • min_ram_mb - (Optional) Amount of ram (in MB) required to boot image. Defauts to 0.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the image.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: • properties - (Optional) A map of key/value pairs to set freeform information about an image. See the "Notes" section for further information about properties.

properties.name: protected
properties.description: • protected - (Optional) If true, image will not be deletable. Defaults to false.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Glance client. A Glance client is needed to create an Image that can be used with a compute instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new Image.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) The tags of the image. It must be a list of strings. At this time, it is not possible to delete all tags of an image.

properties.name: verify_checksum
properties.description: • verify_checksum - (Optional) If false, the checksum will not be verified once the image is finished uploading. Defaults to true.

properties.name: visibility
properties.description: • visibility - (Optional) The visibility of the image. Must be one of "public", "private", "community", or "shared". The ability to set the visibility depends upon the configuration of the OpenStack cloud.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Glance client. A Glance client is needed to manage Image members. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new resource.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Required) The image ID.

properties.name: member_id
properties.description: • member_id - (Required) The member ID, e.g. the target project ID.

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - (Optional) The member proposal status. Optional if admin wants to force the member proposal acceptance. Can either be accepted, rejected or pending. Defaults to pending. Foridden for non-admin users.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Glance client. A Glance client is needed to manage Image memberships. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new membership.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Required) The proposed image ID.

properties.name: member_id
properties.description: • member_id - (Optional) The member ID, e.g. the target project ID. Optional for admin accounts. Defaults to the current scope project ID.

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - (Required) The membership proposal status. Can either be accepted, rejected or pending.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron address-scope. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new address-scope.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the address-scope. Changing this updates the name of the existing address-scope.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: • ip_version - (Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this creates a new address-scope.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: • shared - (Optional) Indicates whether this address-scope is shared across all projects. Changing this updates the shared status of the existing address-scope.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Optional) The owner of the address-scope. Required if admin wants to create a address-scope for another project. Changing this creates a new address-scope.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the floating IP.

properties.name: pool
properties.description: • pool - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Optional) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to associate with this floating IP.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The target tenant ID in which to allocate the floating IP, if you specify this together with a port_id, make sure the target port belongs to the same tenant. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address)

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Optional) The actual/specific floating IP to obtain. By default, non-admin users are not able to specify a floating IP, so you must either be an admin user or have had a custom policy or role applied to your OpenStack user or project.

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - Fixed IP of the port to associate with this floating IP. Required if the port has multiple fixed IPs.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Optional) The subnet ID of the floating IP pool. Specify this if the floating IP network has multiple subnets.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the floating IP.

properties.name: dns_name
properties.description: • dns_name - (Optional) The floating IP DNS name. Available, when Neutron DNS extension is enabled. The data in this attribute will be published in an external DNS service when Neutron is configured to integrate with such a service. Changing this creates a new floating IP.

properties.name: dns_domain
properties.description: • dns_domain - (Optional) The floating IP DNS domain. Available, when Neutron DNS extension is enabled. The data in this attribute will be published in an external DNS service when Neutron is configured to integrate with such a service. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

properties.name: floating_ip
properties.description: • floating_ip - (Required) IP Address of an existing floating IP.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Required) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to associate with this floating IP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron network. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new network.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the network. Changing this updates the name of the existing network.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description of the network. Changing this updates the name of the existing network.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: • shared - (Optional) Specifies whether the network resource can be accessed by any tenant or not. Changing this updates the sharing capabilities of the existing network.

properties.name: external
properties.description: • external - (Optional) Specifies whether the network resource has the external routing facility. Valid values are true and false. Defaults to false. Changing this updates the external attribute of the existing network.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the network. Required if admin wants to create a network for another tenant. Changing this creates a new network.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the network. Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the state of the existing network.

properties.name: segments
properties.description: • segments - (Optional) An array of one or more provider segment objects.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: availability_zone_hints
properties.description: • availability_zone_hints - (Optional) An availability zone is used to make network resources highly available. Used for resources with high availability so that they are scheduled on different availability zones. Changing this creates a new network.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the network.

properties.name: transparent_vlan
properties.description: • transparent_vlan - (Optional) Specifies whether the network resource has the VLAN transparent attribute set. Valid values are true and false. Defaults to false. Changing this updates the transparent_vlan attribute of the existing network.

properties.name: port_security_enabled
properties.description: • port_security_enabled - (Optional) Whether to explicitly enable or disable port security on the network. Port Security is usually enabled by default, so omitting this argument will usually result in a value of "true". Setting this explicitly to false will disable port security. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: mtu
properties.description: • mtu - (Optional) The network MTU. Available for read-only, when Neutron net-mtu extension is enabled. Available for the modification, when Neutron net-mtu-writable extension is enabled.

properties.name: dns_domain
properties.description: • dns_domain - (Optional) The network DNS domain. Available, when Neutron DNS extension is enabled. The dns_domain of a network in conjunction with the dns_name attribute of its ports will be published in an external DNS service when Neutron is configured to integrate with such a service.

properties.name: qos_policy_id
properties.description: • qos_policy_id - (Optional) Reference to the associated QoS policy.
The segments block supports:

properties.name: physical_network
properties.description: The physical network where this network is implemented.

properties.name: segmentation_id
properties.description: An isolated segment on the physical network.

properties.name: network_type
properties.description: The type of physical network.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the port. Changing this updates the name of an existing port.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description of the floating IP. Changing this updates the description of an existing port.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The ID of the network to attach the port to. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the port (must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing port.

properties.name: mac_address
properties.description: • mac_address - (Optional) Specify a specific MAC address for the port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the Port. Required if admin wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: device_owner
properties.description: • device_owner - (Optional) The device owner of the Port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: security_group_ids
properties.description: • security_group_ids - (Optional - Conflicts with no_security_groups) A list of security group IDs to apply to the port. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).

properties.name: no_security_groups
properties.description: • no_security_groups - (Optional - Conflicts with security_group_ids) If set to true, then no security groups are applied to the port. If set to false and no security_group_ids are specified, then the Port will yield to the default behavior of the Networking service, which is to usually apply the "default" security group.

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: • device_id - (Optional) The ID of the device attached to the port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - (Optional - Conflicts with no_fixed_ip) An array of desired IPs for this port. The structure is described below.

properties.name: no_fixed_ip
properties.description: • no_fixed_ip - (Optional - Conflicts with fixed_ip) Create a port with no fixed IP address. This will also remove any fixed IPs previously set on a port. true is the only valid value for this argument.

properties.name: allowed_address_pairs
properties.description: • allowed_address_pairs - (Optional) An IP/MAC Address pair of additional IP addresses that can be active on this port. The structure is described below.

properties.name: extra_dhcp_option
properties.description: • extra_dhcp_option - (Optional) An extra DHCP option that needs to be configured on the port. The structure is described below. Can be specified multiple times.

properties.name: port_security_enabled
properties.description: • port_security_enabled - (Optional) Whether to explicitly enable or disable port security on the port. Port Security is usually enabled by default, so omitting argument will usually result in a value of "true". Setting this explicitly to false will disable port security. In order to disable port security, the port must not have any security groups. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the port.

properties.name: binding
properties.description: • binding - (Optional) The port binding allows to specify binding information for the port. The structure is described below.

properties.name: dns_name
properties.description: • dns_name - (Optional) The port DNS name. Available, when Neutron DNS extension is enabled.

properties.name: qos_policy_id
properties.description: • qos_policy_id - (Optional) Reference to the associated QoS policy.
The fixed_ip block supports:

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Subnet in which to allocate IP address for this port.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) IP address desired in the subnet for this port. If you don't specify ip_address, an available IP address from the specified subnet will be allocated to this port. This field will not be populated if it is left blank or omitted. To retrieve the assigned IP address, use the all_fixed_ips attribute.
The allowed_address_pairs block supports:

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Required) The additional IP address.

properties.name: mac_address
properties.description: • mac_address - (Optional) The additional MAC address.
The extra_dhcp_option block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the DHCP option.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Value of the DHCP option.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: • ip_version - (Optional) IP protocol version. Defaults to 4.
The binding block supports:

properties.name: host_id
properties.description: • host_id - (Optional) The ID of the host to allocate port on.

properties.name: profile
properties.description: • profile - (Optional) Custom data to be passed as binding:profile. Data must be passed as JSON.

properties.name: vnic_type
properties.description: • vnic_type - (Optional) VNIC type for the port. Can either be direct, direct-physical, macvtap, normal, baremetal or virtio-forwarder. Default value is normal.

properties.name: vif_details
properties.description: • vif_details - (Computed) A map of JSON strings containing additional details for this specific binding.

properties.name: vif_type
properties.description: • vif_type - (Computed) The VNIC type of the port binding.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to manage a port. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new resource.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Required) An UUID of the port to apply security groups to.

properties.name: security_group_ids
properties.description: • security_group_ids - (Required) A list of security group IDs to apply to the port. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).

properties.name: enforce
properties.description: • enforce - (Optional) Whether to replace or append the list of security groups, specified in the security_group_ids. Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron QoS bandwidth limit rule. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new QoS bandwidth limit rule.

properties.name: qos_policy_id
properties.description: • qos_policy_id - (Required) The QoS policy reference. Changing this creates a new QoS bandwidth limit rule.

properties.name: max_kbps
properties.description: • max_kbps - (Required) The maximum kilobits per second of a QoS bandwidth limit rule. Changing this updates the maximum kilobits per second of the existing QoS bandwidth limit rule.

properties.name: max_burst_kbps
properties.description: • max_burst_kbps - (Optional) The maximum burst size in kilobits of a QoS bandwidth limit rule. Changing this updates the maximum burst size in kilobits of the existing QoS bandwidth limit rule.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Optional) The direction of traffic. Defaults to "egress". Changing this updates the direction of the existing QoS bandwidth limit rule.

properties.name: region

properties.name: qos_policy_id
properties.description: • qos_policy_id - (Required) The QoS policy reference. Changing this creates a new QoS DSCP marking rule.

properties.name: dscp_mark
properties.description: • dscp_mark - (Required) The value of DSCP mark. Changing this updates the DSCP mark value existing QoS DSCP marking rule.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron QoS minimum bandwidth rule. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new QoS minimum bandwidth rule.

properties.name: qos_policy_id
properties.description: • qos_policy_id - (Required) The QoS policy reference. Changing this creates a new QoS minimum bandwidth rule.

properties.name: min_kbps
properties.description: • min_kbps - (Required) The minimum kilobits per second. Changing this updates the min kbps value of the existing QoS minimum bandwidth rule.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Optional) The direction of traffic. Defaults to "egress". Changing this updates the direction of the existing QoS minimum bandwidth rule.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron Qos policy. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new QoS policy.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the QoS policy. Changing this updates the name of the existing QoS policy.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Optional) The owner of the QoS policy. Required if admin wants to create a QoS policy for another project. Changing this creates a new QoS policy.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: • shared - (Optional) Indicates whether this QoS policy is shared across all projects. Changing this updates the shared status of the existing QoS policy.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the QoS policy. Changing this updates the description of the existing QoS policy.

properties.name: is_default
properties.description: • is_default - (Optional) Indicates whether the QoS policy is default QoS policy or not. Changing this updates the default status of the existing QoS policy.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: tags

properties.name: floatingip

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Optional) Quota value for networks. Changing this updates the existing quota.

properties.name: port
