properties.name: rbac_policy
properties.description: • rbac_policy - (Optional) Quota value for RBAC policies. Changing this updates the existing quota.

properties.name: router
properties.description: • router - (Optional) Quota value for routers. Changing this updates the existing quota.

properties.name: security_group
properties.description: • security_group - (Optional) Quota value for security groups. Changing this updates the existing quota.

properties.name: security_group_rule
properties.description: • security_group_rule - (Optional) Quota value for security group rules. Changing this updates the existing quota.

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet - (Optional) Quota value for subnets. Changing this updates the existing quota.

properties.name: subnetpool
properties.description: • subnetpool - (Optional) Quota value for subnetpools. Changing this updates the existing quota.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a router. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) ID of the router this interface belongs to. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - ID of the subnet this interface connects to. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - ID of the port this interface connects to. Changing this creates a new router interface.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to configure a routing entry on a router. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) ID of the router this routing entry belongs to. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: destination_cidr
properties.description: • destination_cidr - (Required) CIDR block to match on the packet’s destination IP. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: next_hop
properties.description: • next_hop - (Required) IP address of the next hop gateway. Changing this creates a new routing entry.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a router. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new router.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the router. Changing this updates the name of an existing router.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the router.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the router (must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing router.

properties.name: distributed
properties.description: • distributed - (Optional) Indicates whether or not to create a distributed router. The default policy setting in Neutron restricts usage of this property to administrative users only.

properties.name: external_gateway
properties.description: • external_gateway - (Deprecated - use external_network_id instead) The network UUID of an external gateway for the router. A router with an external gateway is required if any compute instances or load balancers will be using floating IPs. Changing this updates the external gateway of an existing router.

properties.name: external_network_id
properties.description: • external_network_id - (Optional) The network UUID of an external gateway for the router. A router with an external gateway is required if any compute instances or load balancers will be using floating IPs. Changing this updates the external gateway of the router.

properties.name: enable_snat
properties.description: • enable_snat - (Optional) Enable Source NAT for the router. Valid values are "true" or "false". An external_network_id has to be set in order to set this property. Changing this updates the enable_snat of the router.

properties.name: external_fixed_ip
properties.description: • external_fixed_ip - (Optional) An external fixed IP for the router. This can be repeated. The structure is described below. An external_network_id has to be set in order to set this property. Changing this updates the external fixed IPs of the router.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the floating IP. Required if admin wants to create a router for another tenant. Changing this creates a new router.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional driver-specific options.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the router.

properties.name: vendor_options
properties.description: • vendor_options - (Optional) Map of additional vendor-specific options. Supported options are described below.

properties.name: availability_zone_hints
properties.description: • availability_zone_hints - (Optional) An availability zone is used to make network resources highly available. Used for resources with high availability so that they are scheduled on different availability zones. Changing this creates a new router.
The external_fixed_ip block supports:

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Optional) Subnet in which the fixed IP belongs to.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) The IP address to set on the router.
The vendor_options block supports:

properties.name: set_router_gateway_after_create
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean to control whether the Router gateway is assigned during creation or updated after creation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron subnet. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The UUID of the parent network. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Optional) CIDR representing IP range for this subnet, based on IP version. You can omit this option if you are creating a subnet from a subnet pool.

properties.name: prefix_length
properties.description: • prefix_length - (Optional) The prefix length to use when creating a subnet from a subnet pool. The default subnet pool prefix length that was defined when creating the subnet pool will be used if not provided. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: • ip_version - (Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: ipv6_address_mode
properties.description: • ipv6_address_mode - (Optional) The IPv6 address mode. Valid values are dhcpv6-stateful, dhcpv6-stateless, or slaac.

properties.name: ipv6_ra_mode
properties.description: • ipv6_ra_mode - (Optional) The IPv6 Router Advertisement mode. Valid values are dhcpv6-stateful, dhcpv6-stateless, or slaac.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the subnet. Changing this updates the name of the existing subnet.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description of the subnet. Changing this updates the name of the existing subnet.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the subnet. Required if admin wants to create a subnet for another tenant. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: allocation_pools
properties.description: • allocation_pools - (Deprecated - use allocation_pool instead) A block declaring the start and end range of the IP addresses available for use with DHCP in this subnet. The allocation_pools block is documented below.

properties.name: allocation_pool
properties.description: • allocation_pool - (Optional) A block declaring the start and end range of the IP addresses available for use with DHCP in this subnet. Multiple allocation_pool blocks can be declared, providing the subnet with more than one range of IP addresses to use with DHCP. However, each IP range must be from the same CIDR that the subnet is part of. The allocation_pool block is documented below.

properties.name: gateway_ip
properties.description: • gateway_ip - (Optional) Default gateway used by devices in this subnet. Leaving this blank and not setting no_gateway will cause a default gateway of .1 to be used. Changing this updates the gateway IP of the existing subnet.

properties.name: no_gateway
properties.description: • no_gateway - (Optional) Do not set a gateway IP on this subnet. Changing this removes or adds a default gateway IP of the existing subnet.

properties.name: enable_dhcp
properties.description: • enable_dhcp - (Optional) The administrative state of the network. Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value enables or disables the DHCP capabilities of the existing subnet. Defaults to true.

properties.name: dns_nameservers
properties.description: • dns_nameservers - (Optional) An array of DNS name server names used by hosts in this subnet. Changing this updates the DNS name servers for the existing subnet.

properties.name: host_routes
properties.description: • host_routes - (Deprecated - use openstack_networking_subnet_route_v2 instead) An array of routes that should be used by devices with IPs from this subnet (not including local subnet route). The host_route object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the host routes for the existing subnet.

properties.name: subnetpool_id
properties.description: • subnetpool_id - (Optional) The ID of the subnetpool associated with the subnet.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the subnet.
The deprecated allocation_pools block supports:

properties.name: start
properties.description: • start - (Required) The starting address.

properties.name: end
properties.description: • end - (Required) The ending address.
The allocation_pool block supports:

properties.name: start
properties.description: • start - (Required) The starting address.

properties.name: end
properties.description: • end - (Required) The ending address.
The host_routes block supports:

properties.name: destination_cidr
properties.description: • destination_cidr - (Required) The destination CIDR.

properties.name: next_hop
properties.description: • next_hop - (Required) The next hop in the route.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to configure a routing entry on a subnet. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) ID of the subnet this routing entry belongs to. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: destination_cidr
properties.description: • destination_cidr - (Required) CIDR block to match on the packet’s destination IP. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: next_hop
properties.description: • next_hop - (Required) IP address of the next hop gateway. Changing this creates a new routing entry.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron subnetpool. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new subnetpool.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the subnetpool. Changing this updates the name of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: default_quota
properties.description: • default_quota - (Optional) The per-project quota on the prefix space that can be allocated from the subnetpool for project subnets. Changing this updates the default quota of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Optional) The owner of the subnetpool. Required if admin wants to create a subnetpool for another project. Changing this creates a new subnetpool.

properties.name: prefixes
properties.description: • prefixes - (Required) A list of subnet prefixes to assign to the subnetpool. Neutron API merges adjacent prefixes and treats them as a single prefix. Each subnet prefix must be unique among all subnet prefixes in all subnetpools that are associated with the address scope. Changing this updates the prefixes list of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: default_prefixlen
properties.description: • default_prefixlen - (Optional) The size of the prefix to allocate when the cidr or prefixlen attributes are omitted when you create the subnet. Defaults to the MinPrefixLen. Changing this updates the default prefixlen of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: min_prefixlen
properties.description: • min_prefixlen - (Optional) The smallest prefix that can be allocated from a subnetpool. For IPv4 subnetpools, default is 8. For IPv6 subnetpools, default is 64. Changing this updates the min prefixlen of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: max_prefixlen
properties.description: • max_prefixlen - (Optional) The maximum prefix size that can be allocated from the subnetpool. For IPv4 subnetpools, default is 32. For IPv6 subnetpools, default is 128. Changing this updates the max prefixlen of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: address_scope_id
properties.description: • address_scope_id - (Optional) The Neutron address scope to assign to the subnetpool. Changing this updates the address scope id of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: • shared - (Optional) Indicates whether this subnetpool is shared across all projects. Changing this updates the shared status of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the subnetpool. Changing this updates the description of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: is_default
properties.description: • is_default - (Optional) Indicates whether the subnetpool is default subnetpool or not. Changing this updates the default status of the existing subnetpool.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the subnetpool.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new security group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the security group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A unique name for the security group.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the security group. Required if admin wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new security group.

properties.name: delete_default_rules
properties.description: • delete_default_rules - (Optional) Whether or not to delete the default egress security rules. This is false by default. See the below note for more information.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the security group.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the rule. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Required) The direction of the rule, valid values are ingress or egress. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: ethertype
properties.description: • ethertype - (Required) The layer 3 protocol type, valid values are IPv4 or IPv6. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: protocol - (Optional) The layer 4 protocol type, valid values are following. Changing this creates a new security group rule. This is required if you want to specify a port range.
• tcp
• udp
• icmp
• ah
• dccp
• egp
• esp
• gre
• igmp
• ipv6-encap
• ipv6-frag
• ipv6-icmp
• ipv6-nonxt
• ipv6-opts
• ipv6-route
• ospf
• pgm
• rsvp
• sctp
• udplite
• vrrp

properties.name: port_range_min
properties.description: • port_range_min - (Optional) The lower part of the allowed port range, valid integer value needs to be between 1 and 65535. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: port_range_max
properties.description: • port_range_max - (Optional) The higher part of the allowed port range, valid integer value needs to be between 1 and 65535. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: remote_ip_prefix
properties.description: • remote_ip_prefix - (Optional) The remote CIDR, the value needs to be a valid CIDR (i.e. 192.168.0.0/16). Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: remote_group_id
properties.description: • remote_group_id - (Optional) The remote group id, the value needs to be an Openstack ID of a security group in the same tenant. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) The security group id the rule should belong to, the value needs to be an Openstack ID of a security group in the same tenant. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the security group. Required if admin wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new security group rule.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a trunk. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new trunk.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the trunk. Changing this updates the name of an existing trunk.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description of the trunk. Changing this updates the name of the existing trunk.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Required) The ID of the port to be used as the parent port of the trunk. This is the port that should be used as the compute instance network port. Changing this creates a new trunk.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the trunk (must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing trunk.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the Trunk. Required if admin wants to create a trunk on behalf of another tenant. Changing this creates a new trunk.

properties.name: sub_port
properties.description: • sub_port - (Optional) The set of ports that will be made subports of the trunk. The structure of each subport is described below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A set of string tags for the port.
The sub_port block supports:

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Required) The ID of the port to be made a subport of the trunk.

properties.name: segmentation_type
properties.description: • segmentation_type - (Required) The segmentation technology to use, e.g., "vlan".

properties.name: segmentation_id
properties.description: • segmentation_id - (Required) The numeric id of the subport segment.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to configure a routing entry on a subnet. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) Action for the RBAC policy. Can either be access_as_external or access_as_shared.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: • object_id - (Required) The ID of the object_type resource. An object_type of network returns a network ID and an object_type of qos_policy returns a QoS ID.

properties.name: object_type
properties.description: • object_type - (Required) The type of the object that the RBAC policy affects. Can either be qos-policy or network.

properties.name: target_tenant
properties.description: • target_tenant - (Required) The ID of the tenant to which the RBAC policy will be enforced.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an LB member. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new LB member.

properties.name: pool_id
properties.description: • pool_id - (Required) The ID of the LB pool. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) The IP address of the member. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) An integer representing the port on which the member is hosted. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the member. Acceptable values are 'true' and 'false'. Changing this value updates the state of the existing member.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the member. Required if admin wants to create a member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new member.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an LB monitor. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new LB monitor.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of probe, which is PING, TCP, HTTP, or HTTPS, that is sent by the monitor to verify the member state. Changing this creates a new monitor.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: • delay - (Required) The time, in seconds, between sending probes to members. Changing this creates a new monitor.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: • timeout - (Required) Maximum number of seconds for a monitor to wait for a ping reply before it times out. The value must be less than the delay value. Changing this updates the timeout of the existing monitor.

properties.name: max_retries
properties.description: • max_retries - (Required) Number of permissible ping failures before changing the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1 and 10. Changing this updates the max_retries of the existing monitor.

properties.name: url_path
properties.description: • url_path - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. URI path that will be accessed if monitor type is HTTP or HTTPS. Changing this updates the url_path of the existing monitor.

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: • http_method - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. The HTTP method used for requests by the monitor. If this attribute is not specified, it defaults to "GET". Changing this updates the http_method of the existing monitor.

properties.name: expected_codes
properties.description: • expected_codes - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like "200", or a range like "200-202". Changing this updates the expected_codes of the existing monitor.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the monitor. Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the state of the existing monitor.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the monitor. Required if admin wants to create a monitor for another tenant. Changing this creates a new monitor.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an LB pool. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new LB pool.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the pool. Changing this updates the name of the existing pool.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The protocol used by the pool members, you can use either 'TCP, 'HTTP', or 'HTTPS'. Changing this creates a new pool.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The network on which the members of the pool will be located. Only members that are on this network can be added to the pool. Changing this creates a new pool.

properties.name: lb_method
properties.description: • lb_method - (Required) The algorithm used to distribute load between the members of the pool. The current specification supports 'ROUND_ROBIN' and 'LEAST_CONNECTIONS' as valid values for this attribute.

properties.name: lb_provider
properties.description: • lb_provider - (Optional) The backend load balancing provider. For example: haproxy, F5, etc.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the pool. Required if admin wants to create a pool member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new pool.

properties.name: monitor_ids
properties.description: • monitor_ids - (Optional) A list of IDs of monitors to associate with the pool.

properties.name: member
properties.description: • member - (Optional) An existing node to add to the pool. Changing this updates the members of the pool. The member object structure is documented below. Please note that the member block is deprecated in favor of the openstack_lb_member_v1 resource.
The member block supports:

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) The IP address of the member. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) An integer representing the port on which the member is hosted. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Required) The administrative state of the member. Acceptable values are 'true' and 'false'. Changing this value updates the state of the existing member.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the member. Required if admin wants to create a pool member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new member.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a VIP. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new VIP.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the vip. Changing this updates the name of the existing vip.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The network on which to allocate the vip's address. A tenant can only create vips on networks authorized by policy (e.g. networks that belong to them or networks that are shared). Changing this creates a new vip.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The protocol - can be either 'TCP, 'HTTP', or HTTPS'. Changing this creates a new vip.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) The port on which to listen for client traffic. Changing this creates a new vip.

properties.name: pool_id

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the vip. Required if admin wants to create a vip member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new vip.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Optional) The IP address of the vip. Changing this creates a new vip.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the vip. Changing this updates the description of the existing vip.

properties.name: persistence
properties.description: • persistence - (Optional) Omit this field to prevent session persistence. The persistence object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the persistence of the existing vip.

properties.name: conn_limit
properties.description: • conn_limit - (Optional) The maximum number of connections allowed for the vip. Default is -1, meaning no limit. Changing this updates the conn_limit of the existing vip.

properties.name: floating_ip
properties.description: • floating_ip - (Optional) A Networking Floating IP that will be associated with the vip. The Floating IP must be provisioned already.

properties.name: admin_state_up

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of persistence mode. Valid values are "SOURCE_IP", "HTTP_COOKIE", or "APP_COOKIE".

properties.name: cookie_name
properties.description: • cookie_name - (Optional) The name of the cookie if persistence mode is set appropriately.

properties.description: • l7policy_id - (Required) The ID of the L7 Policy to query. Changing this creates a new L7 Rule.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The value to use for the comparison. For example, the file type to compare.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Optional) The key to use for the comparison. For example, the name of the cookie to evaluate. Valid when type is set to COOKIE or HEADER.

properties.name: invert
properties.description: • invert - (Optional) When true the logic of the rule is inverted. For example, with invert true, equal to would become not equal to. Default is false.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the L7 Rule. A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v1 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a firewall. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new firewall.

properties.name: policy_id
properties.description: • policy_id - (Required) The policy resource id for the firewall. Changing this updates the policy_id of an existing firewall.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name for the firewall. Changing this updates the name of an existing firewall.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description for the firewall. Changing this updates the description of an existing firewall.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the firewall (must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "true"). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing firewall.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the floating IP. Required if admin wants to create a firewall for another tenant. Changing this creates a new firewall.

properties.name: associated_routers
properties.description: • associated_routers - (Optional) Router(s) to associate this firewall instance with. Must be a list of strings. Changing this updates the associated routers of an existing firewall. Conflicts with no_routers.

properties.name: no_routers
properties.description: • no_routers - (Optional) Should this firewall not be associated with any routers (must be "true" or "false" if provide - defaults to "false"). Conflicts with associated_routers.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v1 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a firewall policy. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new firewall policy.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name for the firewall policy. Changing this updates the name of an existing firewall policy.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for the firewall policy. Changing this updates the description of an existing firewall policy.

properties.name: rules
properties.description: • rules - (Optional) An array of one or more firewall rules that comprise the policy. Changing this results in adding/removing rules from the existing firewall policy.

properties.name: audited
properties.description: • audited - (Optional) Audit status of the firewall policy (must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "false"). This status is set to "false" whenever the firewall policy or any of its rules are changed. Changing this updates the audited status of an existing firewall policy.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: • shared - (Optional) Sharing status of the firewall policy (must be "true" or "false" if provided). If this is "true" the policy is visible to, and can be used in, firewalls in other tenants. Changing this updates the shared status of an existing firewall policy. Only administrative users can specify if the policy should be shared.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v1 Compute client. A Compute client is needed to create a firewall rule. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new firewall rule.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the firewall rule. Changing this updates the name of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for the firewall rule. Changing this updates the description of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The protocol type on which the firewall rule operates. Valid values are: tcp, udp, icmp, and any. Changing this updates the protocol of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) Action to be taken ( must be "allow" or "deny") when the firewall rule matches. Changing this updates the action of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: • ip_version - (Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this updates the ip_version of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: source_ip_address
properties.description: • source_ip_address - (Optional) The source IP address on which the firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the source_ip_address of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: destination_ip_address
properties.description: • destination_ip_address - (Optional) The destination IP address on which the firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the destination_ip_address of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: source_port
properties.description: • source_port - (Optional) The source port on which the firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the source_port of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: destination_port
properties.description: • destination_port - (Optional) The destination port on which the firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the destination_port of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Enabled status for the firewall rule (must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "true"). Changing this updates the enabled status of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the firewall rule. Required if admin wants to create a firewall rule for another tenant. Changing this creates a new firewall rule.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the container. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new container.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the container. Changing this creates a new container.

properties.name: container_read
properties.description: • container_read - (Optional) Sets an access control list (ACL) that grants read access. This header can contain a comma-delimited list of users that can read the container (allows the GET method for all objects in the container). Changing this updates the access control list read access.

properties.name: container_sync_to
properties.description: • container_sync_to - (Optional) The destination for container synchronization. Changing this updates container synchronization.

properties.name: container_sync_key
properties.description: • container_sync_key - (Optional) The secret key for container synchronization. Changing this updates container synchronization.

properties.name: container_write
properties.description: • container_write - (Optional) Sets an ACL that grants write access. Changing this updates the access control list write access.

properties.name: versioning
properties.description: • versioning - (Optional) Enable object versioning. The structure is described below.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Custom key/value pairs to associate with the container. Changing this updates the existing container metadata.

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: • content_type - (Optional) The MIME type for the container. Changing this updates the MIME type.

properties.name: force_destroy
properties.description: • force_destroy - (Optional, Default:false ) A boolean that indicates all objects should be deleted from the container so that the container can be destroyed without error. These objects are not recoverable.
The versioning block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Versioning type which can be versions or history according to Openstack documentation.

properties.name: location
properties.description: (Required) Container in which versions will be stored.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: container_name
properties.description: • container_name - (Required) A unique (within an account) name for the container. The container name must be from 1 to 256 characters long and can start with any character and contain any pattern. Character set must be UTF-8. The container name cannot contain a slash (/) character because this character delimits the container and object name. For example, the path /v1/account/www/pages specifies the www container, not the www/pages container.

properties.name: content
properties.description: • content - (Optional) A string representing the content of the object. Conflicts with source and copy_from.

properties.name: content_disposition
properties.description: • content_disposition - (Optional) A string which specifies the override behavior for the browser. For example, this header might specify that the browser use a download program to save this file rather than show the file, which is the default.

properties.name: content_encoding
properties.description: • content_encoding - (Optional) A string representing the value of the Content-Encoding metadata.

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: • content_type - (Optional) A string which sets the MIME type for the object.

properties.name: copy_from
properties.description: • copy_from - (Optional) A string representing the name of an object used to create the new object by copying the copy_from object. The value is in form {container}/{object}. You must UTF-8-encode and then URL-encode the names of the container and object before you include them in the header. Conflicts with source and content.

properties.name: delete_after
properties.description: • delete_after - (Optional) An integer representing the number of seconds after which the system removes the object. Internally, the Object Storage system stores this value in the X-Delete-At metadata item.

properties.name: delete_at
properties.description: • delete_at - (Optional) An string representing the date when the system removes the object. For example, "2015-08-26" is equivalent to Mon, Wed, 26 Aug 2015 00:00:00 GMT.

properties.name: detect_content_type
properties.description: • detect_content_type - (Optional) If set to true, Object Storage guesses the content type based on the file extension and ignores the value sent in the Content-Type header, if present.

properties.name: etag
properties.description: • etag - (Optional) Used to trigger updates. The only meaningful value is ${md5(file("path/to/file"))}.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the object.

properties.name: object_manifest
properties.description: • object_manifest - (Optional) A string set to specify that this is a dynamic large object manifest object. The value is the container and object name prefix of the segment objects in the form container/prefix. You must UTF-8-encode and then URL-encode the names of the container and prefix before you include them in this header.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the container. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new container.

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Optional) A string representing the local path of a file which will be used as the object's content. Conflicts with source and copy_from.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region the tempurl is located in.

properties.name: container
properties.description: • container - (Required) The container name the object belongs to.

properties.name: object
properties.description: • object - (Required) The object name the tempurl is for.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Required) The TTL, in seconds, for the URL. For how long it should be valid.

properties.name: method
properties.description: • method - (Optional) The method allowed when accessing this URL. Valid values are GET, and POST. Default is GET.

properties.name: regenerate
properties.description: • regenerate - (Optional) Whether to automatically regenerate the URL when it has expired. If set to true, this will create a new resource with a new ID and new URL. Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an IPSec policy. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new policy.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the policy. Changing this updates the name of the existing policy.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the policy. Required if admin wants to create a policy for another project. Changing this creates a new policy.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the policy. Changing this updates the description of the existing policy.

properties.name: auth_algorithm
properties.description: • auth_algorithm - (Optional) The authentication hash algorithm. Valid values are sha1, sha256, sha384, sha512. Default is sha1. Changing this updates the algorithm of the existing policy.

properties.name: encapsulation_mode
properties.description: • encapsulation_mode - (Optional) The encapsulation mode. Valid values are tunnel and transport. Default is tunnel. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: encryption_algorithm
properties.description: • encryption_algorithm - (Optional) The encryption algorithm. Valid values are 3des, aes-128, aes-192 and so on. The default value is aes-128. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: pfs
properties.description: • pfs - (Optional) The perfect forward secrecy mode. Valid values are Group2, Group5 and Group14. Default is Group5. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: transform_protocol
properties.description: • transform_protocol - (Optional) The transform protocol. Valid values are ESP, AH and AH-ESP. Changing this updates the existing policy. Default is ESP.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: lifetime - (Optional) The lifetime of the security association. Consists of Unit and Value.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: (Optional) The units for the lifetime of the security association. Can be either seconds or kilobytes. Default is seconds.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) The value for the lifetime of the security association. Must be a positive integer. Default is 3600.

properties.name: encryption_algorithm

properties.name: pfs

properties.name: phase1_negotiation_mode

properties.name: ike_version
properties.description: • ike_version - (Optional) The IKE mode. A valid value is v1 or v2. Default is v1. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: list description

properties.name: unit

properties.name: value

properties.name: name

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the service. Required if admin wants to create a service for another project. Changing this creates a new service.

properties.name: description

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the resource. Can either be up(true) or down(false). Changing this updates the administrative state of the existing service.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Optional) SubnetID is the ID of the subnet. Default is null.

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) The ID of the router. Changing this creates a new service.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an endpoint group. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the group. Changing this updates the name of the existing group.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the group. Required if admin wants to create an endpoint group for another project. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the group. Changing this updates the description of the existing group.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - The type of the endpoints in the group. A valid value is subnet, cidr, network, router, or vlan. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: endpoints
properties.description: • endpoints - List of endpoints of the same type, for the endpoint group. The values will depend on the type. Changing this creates a new group.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an IPSec site connection. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new site connection.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the connection. Changing this updates the name of the existing connection.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the connection. Required if admin wants to create a connection for another project. Changing this creates a new connection.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the connection. Changing this updates the description of the existing connection.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the resource. Can either be up(true) or down(false). Changing this updates the administrative state of the existing connection.

properties.name: ikepolicy_id
properties.description: • ikepolicy_id - (Required) The ID of the IKE policy. Changing this creates a new connection.

properties.name: vpnservice_id
properties.description: • vpnservice_id - (Required) The ID of the VPN service. Changing this creates a new connection.

properties.name: local_ep_group_id
properties.description: • local_ep_group_id - (Optional) The ID for the endpoint group that contains private subnets for the local side of the connection. You must specify this parameter with the peer_ep_group_id parameter unless in backward- compatible mode where peer_cidrs is provided with a subnet_id for the VPN service. Changing this updates the existing connection.

properties.name: ipsecpolicy_id
properties.description: • ipsecpolicy_id - (Required) The ID of the IPsec policy. Changing this creates a new connection.

properties.name: peer_id
properties.description: • peer_id - (Required) The peer router identity for authentication. A valid value is an IPv4 address, IPv6 address, e-mail address, key ID, or FQDN. Typically, this value matches the peer_address value. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: peer_ep_group_id
properties.description: • peer_ep_group_id - (Optional) The ID for the endpoint group that contains private CIDRs in the form < net_address > / < prefix > for the peer side of the connection. You must specify this parameter with the local_ep_group_id parameter unless in backward-compatible mode where peer_cidrs is provided with a subnet_id for the VPN service.

properties.name: local_id
properties.description: • local_id - (Optional) An ID to be used instead of the external IP address for a virtual router used in traffic between instances on different networks in east-west traffic. Most often, local ID would be domain name, email address, etc. If this is not configured then the external IP address will be used as the ID.

properties.name: peer_address
properties.description: • peer_address - (Required) The peer gateway public IPv4 or IPv6 address or FQDN.

properties.name: psk
properties.description: • psk - (Required) The pre-shared key. A valid value is any string.

properties.name: initiator
properties.description: • initiator - (Optional) A valid value is response-only or bi-directional. Default is bi-directional.

properties.name: peer_cidrs
properties.description: • peer_cidrs - (Optional) Unique list of valid peer private CIDRs in the form < net_address > / < prefix > .

properties.name: list description
properties.description: dpd - (Optional) A dictionary with dead peer detection (DPD) protocol controls.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) action. A valid value is clear, hold, restart, disabled, or restart-by-peer. Default value is hold.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) timeout in seconds. A valid value is a positive integer that is greater than the DPD interval value. Default is 120.

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) interval, in seconds. A valid value is a positive integer. Default is 30.

properties.name: mtu
properties.description: • mtu - (Optional) The maximum transmission unit (MTU) value to address fragmentation. Minimum value is 68 for IPv4, and 1280 for IPv6.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: name

properties.name: description

properties.name: type

properties.name: dns_ip
properties.description: • dns_ip - (Optional) The security service DNS IP address that is used inside the tenant network.

properties.name: ou
properties.description: • ou - (Optional) The security service ou. An organizational unit can be added to specify where the share ends up. New in Manila microversion 2.44.

properties.name: user
properties.description: • user - (Optional) The security service user or group name that is used by the tenant.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The user password, if you specify a user.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: • domain - (Optional) The security service domain.

properties.name: server
properties.description: • server - (Optional) The security service host name or IP address.

properties.name: name

properties.name: description

properties.name: neutron_net_id

properties.name: neutron_subnet_id
properties.description: • neutron_subnet_id - (Required) The UUID of the neutron subnet when setting up or updating a share network. Changing this updates the existing share network if it's not used by shares.

properties.name: security_service_ids

properties.name: region

properties.name: name

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the share. Changing this updates the description of the existing share.

properties.name: share_proto
properties.description: • share_proto - (Required) The share protocol - can either be NFS, CIFS, CEPHFS, GLUSTERFS, HDFS or MAPRFS. Changing this creates a new share.

properties.name: size

properties.name: share_type

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) The share availability zone. Changing this creates a new share.

properties.description: • access_to - (Required) The value that defines the access. Can either be an IP address or a username verified by configured Security Service of the Share Network.

properties.name: access_level

properties.name: name

properties.name: bit_length
properties.description: • bit_length - (Optional) Metadata provided by a user or system for informational purposes.

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: • algorithm - (Optional) Metadata provided by a user or system for informational purposes.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Optional) Metadata provided by a user or system for informational purposes.

properties.description: • payload_content_type - (Optional) (required if payload is included) The media type for the content of the payload. Must be one of text/plain, text/plain;charset=utf-8, text/plain; charset=utf-8, application/octet-stream, application/pkcs8.

properties.name: payload_content_encoding
properties.description: • payload_content_encoding - (Optional) (required if payload is encoded) The encoding used for the payload to be able to include it in the JSON request. Must be either base64 or binary.

properties.name: expiration
properties.description: • expiration - (Optional) The expiration time of the secret in the RFC3339 timestamp format (e.g. 2019-03-09T12:58:49Z). If omitted, a secret will never expire. Changing this creates a new secret.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Additional Metadata for the secret.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V1 KeyManager client. A KeyManager client is needed to create a container. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new V1 container.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Human-readable name for the Container. Does not have to be unique.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Used to indicate the type of container. Must be one of generic, rsa or certificate.

properties.name: secret_refs
properties.description: • secret_refs - (Optional) A set of dictionaries containing references to secrets. The structure is described below.
The secret_refs block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the secret reference. The reference names must correspond the container type, more details are available here.

properties.name: secret_ref
properties.description: • secret_ref - (Required) The secret reference / where to find the secret, URL.
